bibl.title: Robert Ross v. David M. Littlefield.. Complaint
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court Third Judicial District. Holding Terms at Port Townsend

body.p: John M. Izett and files complaint against Robert Ross in that on the 3rd day of September 1867 in the Grand Jury room in the Port Townsend the said Robert Ross did perjure himself in him testifying in the case of the Territory vs M. Williams
Warrant issued against accused and subpoena issued for Wililam H. Taylor and David Littlefield
Same day Robert Ross brought into Court- Chas Bradshaw he appeared as his counsil and James K. Kennedy the Pros. atty appeared for the Territory
After hearing the evidence of William H. Taylor and D. Littlefield and the argument of counsel the justice required prisoner to enter into recognizance with sufficient sureties
to appear and answer on the charge of perjury at this present of the District Court in the sum of $1,000.00 and in default to stand committed to the county jail
having failed to find the requiered security a commitment was handed to Sheriff
I certify the foregoing to be a true manuscript of my docket Served under my hand at Port Townsend this 10th Sept/ 67
